alert.note: Alert for Central Douglas County; Eastern Curry County and Josephine County (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Dense Fog Advisory issued December 20 at 7:50PM PST until December 21 at 10:00AM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...DENSE FOG ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM PST THURSDAY... * WHAT...Visibility of less than a quarter of a mile in dense fog. * WHERE...Central Douglas County and Eastern Curry County and Josephine County. This evening, this includes Grants Pass, Cave Junction, Merlin, Canyonville, and the I-5 passes and hills from northern Josephine County into southern Douglas County. Overnight into Thursday morning, dense fog will expand across Josephine, Douglas, and eastern Curry counties. This will include Agness, Camas Valley, and Roseburg. * WHEN...Until 10 AM PST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Hazardous driving conditions due to low visibility. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: * Slow down and allow for plenty of room between you and other vehicles. * Fog makes objects appear farther away than they are * Use low beams. High beams reflect back thick fog, making visibility worse for you and other drivers. * Be prepared. Keep your headlights clean. That way, you`re ready for low-visibility conditions * Don`t use cruise control. Most crashes occur because the driver is going too fast for weather conditions.

area.areaDesc: Central Douglas County; Eastern Curry County and Josephine County
